page.title: 05MILITARY FLOWER FESTIVAL
page.content: On the 14th June 1985 the orchestra and choir of our school went to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre to perform in front of the Earl and Countess Spencer.When we entered we saw a beautiful display of flowers and life size models of soldiers.We saw stained glass windows showing a battle.In the windows were wreaths for the Royal Marines,Royal Navy,Royal Army,and Royal Air Force.We saw a propeller from one of the war planes.We saw guests arriving and microphones for BBC Radio Northampton being put up.Our picture was taken for the Chronicle & Echo local newspaper.We sang and the orchestra played and afterwards Earl Spencer thanked us.We arrived back at school at 12.45pm.-This Round church is a reproduction of the original Church in Jerusalem and the largest of only four in England,founded in 1100 AD.
